entry.title: BIP sighash_noinput
entry.summary: In a thread, DING FENG expresses concern about the "SIGHASH_NOINPUT" feature, which could pose a risk to reuse addresses. However, Rusty, an expert in the field, explains that the feature is not dangerous if used correctly. SIGHASH_NOINPUT is intended for smart contracts with unique conditions, such as a pair of peers rotating keys according to an agreed schedule, rather than for wallets to spend their own UTXOs. Rusty advises caution and proper usage of the feature.
